questions.text: Who did Carla pour beer on?
questions.explanation:
Her brother.

	Her brother set aside her tip, and every time she was mean or impolite he took away a portion of the tip. Every time he did so, Carla did something to him to retaliate until eventually her tip was gone.

questions.text: Where did Frasier say he was going on vacation?
questions.explanation:
Maui.

	Frasier said that the stupidest person was one that drove through horrific traffic, to sit in an office all day long only to do the same thing day after day. Norm asked him if he was looking forward to his vacation and Frasier said he was.

questions.text: Who was going to fix Sam's computer?
questions.explanation:
Rebecca.

	Sam was quite frustrated with the computer. He said that in the old days he had everything he needed "right here" (and pointed to his head). When asked "Brains?" He replied, "No good hair."

questions.text: Who had a "tickle" in their throat?
questions.explanation:
Cliff.

	Sam was going out to buy pretzels. Cliff asked him to pick up some cough syrup for him.

questions.text: Who lost their raise due to Sam's financial problems?
questions.explanation:
Woody.

	When Sam asked Carla how much her raise was worth to her she said, "More than my kids lives." So Sam said she got to keep hers and asked Woody if he'd take a pay decrease.

Carla.

	He said Sam could call him stupid. Then when he told his idea Sam said he didn't think it would work. Woody said, "I said you could call me stupid, not my idea, doesn't anyone ever listen?"

questions.text: Where did Rebecca get a job?
questions.explanation:
The Auto Show.

	Rebecca was not happy with her job. They had her doing things like using fire to show how good the product was. She was afraid.

questions.text: Who did Sam hire briefly as a manager?
questions.explanation:
Earl.

	Earl was played by Bryan Clark. Clark was born April 5, 1929 in Kentucky. My mother and I thought he looked a lot like Ronald Reagan.

Miracle Buff.

	It was $9.99 a can. Rebecca quit when they refused to give her gloves to use different chemicals and such to show how good the project was.

questions.text: At the end of the episode Earl was still manager.
questions.explanation:
false.

	They were upset that Sam fired Earl because everyone loved him. However, Norm asked "Is this going to raise the price of beer?" to which Sam answered "No." They decided as long as the beer prices didn't increase it was fine that Rebecca was back as manager of the bar.
